conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
Their v-t graphs are shown in the figure.
It is known that the two cars are side by side at t=30s.
What is the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side?
The v-t graph shows two lines, A and B, intersecting at t=30s.
Line A is horizontal after t=10s, indicating constant velocity.
Line B is a straight line with a positive slope, indicating uniform acceleration.
The intersection point at t=30s indicates the cars are side by side.
The vertical axis represents velocity in m/s, and the horizontal axis represents time in s.
The area under the v-t graph represents the displacement of the car.
Identify the instances when the cars are side by side.
Calculate the area under the curve for each car from t=0 to t=30 seconds.
The area under the v-t graph for Car A from t=0 to t=30 seconds is 1000 meters.
The area under the v-t graph for Car B from t=0 to t=30 seconds is 900 meters.
The initial separation at t=0 is 100 meters.
Find the time when the cars are side by side again.
Set up the equation for the displacements of both cars at time t1.
Solve the quadratic equation to find t1.
The maximum distance occurs at t=20 seconds.
Calculate the displacements of both cars at t=20 seconds.
The maximum distance between the cars is 200 meters.
The final answer is 200 meters.
